statements: INSERT INTO knowledge_base_articles (article_id, article_title, article_content) VALUES (1, 'Introduction to SQL', 'SQL (Structured Query Language) is a standard language for managing databases.');
INSERT INTO knowledge_base_articles (article_id, article_title, article_content) VALUES (2, 'Data Types in SQL', 'SQL supports various data types such as INTEGER, VARCHAR, TEXT, etc.');
INSERT INTO knowledge_base_articles (article_id, article_title, article_content) VALUES (3, 'Querying Databases', 'To query databases in SQL, you use SELECT statements to retrieve data.');

INSERT INTO knowledge_base_articles (article_id, article_title, article_content) VALUES (4, 'SQL Joins', 'SQL Joins are used to combine rows from two or more tables based on a related column between them.');

INSERT INTO knowledge_base_articles (article_id, article_title, article_content) VALUES (5, 'Normalization in Databases', 'Normalization is the process of organizing data in a database to reduce redundancy and improve data integrity.');
